p: Rift Valley Fever virus has been reported in humans and cattle in DRC. A low rate (4%) of IgG antibodies from human against RVFV was reported in 1998 from Kisangani in the north-eastern region [ 11]. In 2009, Mulumba et al. [ 34] reported a seroprevalence of 20% among cattle in Katanga in the southern region. In 2018, a seroprevalence (IgG and IgM) of 2â€“16% among cattle was reported in three provinces (Nord-Kivu, Sud-Kivu, Ituri) from the eastern region [ 35]. In 2014, RVFV was also detected by RT-PCR from a pool of Aedes mosquitoes collected around Ndjili River in Kinshasa [ 13].
